html: Similar to Isaiah 30:22 in its censure of idolatry, this appeal to Jehovah’s people to abandon their culture of materialism ends the homiletic theme of chapters 28-31. What more proof do his people want of Jehovah’s desire to deliver them from destruction in his Day of Judgment? Or what additional evidence do they need that their idolatry brings covenant curses? Parallel verses show that his people’s giving up the things they covet that money can buy defines repentance itself. Repenting of worshiping idols, in other words, constitutes an integral part of returning to God (cf. Isaiah 42:17-23; 55:2, 7 ).
